intro: Siphonacanthus, commonly known as the water hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the mallow family, Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Its leaves are usually palmately lobed and have a waxy texture, while its stems are often covered in fine hairs. Siphonacanthus species are typically found in wetland or aquatic environments, where they thrive in moist, sunny conditions.
